isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 3.5: ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS, ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR/IVS SWITCH (APS/IVS) - INJECTION PRESSURE REGULATION SYSTEM (IPR_SYS) - SYSTEM FUNCTIONS

svcproc.title: SYSTEM FUNCTIONS
svcproc.para: The Injection Control Pressure System consists of the low pressure oil lubrication system, passages in the front cover and reservoir, high pressure oil pump, high pressure oil line as well as the high pressure oil rails machined in the cylinder heads. The injection control pressure system also includes the injectors (and their sealing "O" rings), the IPR valve (injection pressure regulator valve) and the ICP (injection control pressure) sensor and associated wiring.
The function of this system is to develop, maintain and control the high pressure injection control pressure to provide the force to actuate the injectors and provide fuel to the engine.
